name: Queenie was a Blonde: Julia Murney Trivia Game | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: What song does Julia sing on the "Hair" benefit recording?
questions.explanation:
Where Do I Go?.

	The "Hair" benefit concert was held on September 20th, 2004. Other performers involved were Raul Esparza, Adam Pascal and Shoshana Bean.

questions.text: What is the title of Julia's first solo CD?
questions.explanation:
I'm Not Waiting.

	"I'm Not Waiting" was released in the spring of 2004 on the Sh-K-Boom label. They also release cast recordings of Broadway musicals and CDs by Adam Pascal.

questions.text: Whom did Julia replace in the "Wicked" tour?
questions.explanation:
Stephanie J. Block

	Julia toured with the "Wicked" first national tour, playing the lead role of Elphaba. The other choices have all been in the cast of "Wicked" at one point or another. Julia joined the cast on March 8th, 2006.

questions.text: What role did Julia sing in the 2003 benefit concert of the rock opera "Chess"?
questions.explanation:
Florence Vassy.

	Julia starred alongside Adam Pascal, Sutton Foster and more at the "Chess" benefit concert held for one day only: September 22nd, 2003. It played at the New Amsterdam Theatre.

questions.text: Julia was a cast member of a short-lived musical based on the songs of this singer and songwriter.
questions.explanation:
John Lennon.

	"Lennon" also starred Terrence Mann and Will Chase. With music and lyrics by Lennon himself and a book by Don Scardino, "Lennon" closed after only forty-nine performances, opening on August 14, 2005 and closing on September 24th of the same year.

questions.text: What role did Julia play while she was in the "Wicked" tour?
questions.explanation:
Elphaba.

	Julia has found a large fanbase simply by being in "Wicked", the story of what took place in Oz before Dorothy came and after Dorothy left. Julia joined the cast on March 8th, 2006.

questions.text: In "The Wild Party", Julia does NOT sing in this song:
questions.explanation:
Poor Child.

	"Poor Child" is sung by Mister Black, who was played by Taye Diggs. The show ran from Febuary 24th, 2000 to April 9th of the same year.

questions.text: What role did Julia play in the Off-Broadway musical "Time and Again"?
questions.explanation:
Kate.

	"Time and Again" was an Off-Broadway musical adapted from the novel of the same name by Jack Finney. It received poor reviews from the critics at the New York Times, and it closed on the 18th of February, 2001, after opening on January 9th of the same year.

questions.text: Julia was cast as Chick in "Crimes of the Heart" Off-Broadway in 2001. Which theatre did this show play at?
questions.explanation:
Second Stage Theatre.

	"Crimes of the Heart" ran from April 16, 2001 through May 14 of the same year. Some other shows that have called the Second Stage Theatre home are "The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee" and Stephen Sondheim's "Saturday Night"

questions.text: Julia was part of the Actors' Fund of America's Benefit Concert of "Funny Girl".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Some other actresses who sang in the concert include Kristen Chenoweth, LaChanze, Judy Kuhn, Ana Gasteyer, Sutton Foster and Carolee Carmello. Julia sang the solo song "People". The concert was performed once on September 23rd, 2002.
